reviews.text: Great Thai food! Classics were amazing, got the green curry and chicken pad Thai

Such a gem! Every single thing was delicious & the prices were so reasonable esp for being in NYC. Service was top tier and the restaurant is super cute and cozy.

Update: Just went here again during a day trip to NYC & it was so good once again! We got the app sampler (veg puffs are the best), chicken pad Thai, and the crab & duck noodles. Lovely service & delish food!

â›”ï¸  Warning about forced tipping!! ğŸ’²
We went there as a group of 4 adults + 1 child (4 years old). They added a mandatory â€œgravity tipâ€ at a 22% tipping rate without informing us beforehand. On top of that, the tall skinny server had a moody attitude toward us.ğŸ‘ğŸ‘

BTW, The food is tasty and authentic. ğŸ‘
Had great noodles at the restaurant.  Service was fantastic.
à¸­à¸£à¹ˆà¸­à¸¢à¸¡à¸²à¸à¹€à¸¥à¸¢à¸„à¹ˆà¸²à¸² the best

My wife and I came here in 2018, absolutely loved it, and came back from across the country in 2025 to experience it once again. We were not disappointed, and it was even BETTER than we remember it! The service was extremely fast, the waiters were so attentive and friendly (they even gave us extra plates to share since they saw us sharing our entrees without us even asking!), and the food is INCREDIBLE!
We will come back any time we find ourselves in New York again in the future!

Even though my online delivery was running late today BECASUE OF THE UBER SYSTEM, as Thursday, October 16th, I decided to pick up my order around 12:35 PM instead.
I want to give a massive shout-out to the waiter working the front! He has the best customer focus and was incredibly helpful during my wait time in the restaurant. I watched him greeting and serving everyone with genuine hospitality and a smile.
As for the food, it's consistently great! I've ordered from this restaurant more than 25 times, and the food is always a winnerâ€”the noodle dishes are my absolute favorite.
Amazing soups and curry, definitely worth the visit
Sono andata a pranzo in questo locale thai, menu vario e sembrava tutto super gustoso! Non frequento da turisti di passaggio (come lo eravamo noi). Conto compreso di mancia 50$. Consigliato!

Iâ€™ve been coming here for over 10 years, and itâ€™s still one of my favorite spots. Even after moving away from New York, I make sure to stop by every time Iâ€™m in town visiting friends. Iâ€™ve never had a dish I didnâ€™t enjoy hereâ€”everything is consistently delicious and comforting, like home-cooked food.

On my latest visit, we had the khao kha moo, ba mi poo, and khao soiâ€”all packed with rich, authentic flavors. The restaurant is always busy, which says a lot, but now that you can make reservations in advance, itâ€™s much more convenient.

This place truly never disappoints and remains a must-visit every time Iâ€™m back in the city.

Thai cuisine is in my top 3 favorite cuisines ever. So much so that I've traveled to Bangkok to eat and learn to cook more than 3 times now. While I have my usual Thai restaurant go tos, Pure Thai is now my favorite when it comes to their noodle soups! I've just recently tried both their beef and roasted pork soups with rice noodles and they were so delicious and comforting! They also do their Thai iced tea just right and have good vegetable spring rolls! Service is warm and friendly even if they get so packed and busy. The restroom is spacious and clean especially in their expanded section which we usually enjoy better. Can't wait to come back soon for my Thai noodle soup fix! :)
Super Thai. Un des meilleurs que j'ai testÃ© hors de ThaÃ¯lande.
Service and food was outstanding. The Pork Trio special was fantastic. Great place to visit and enjoy great food. Oh and get their lychee martini. Chef's kiss.
Muy buena comida . Lugar muy local , sencillo pero no barato . Vale la pena probar , si andas por el rumbo date una vuelta. El personal es sÃºper amable
Healthier/leas oil than most restaurants! Tastes like home cooking :)

It used to be my go-to spot. Unlike many other Thai restaurants, their unique menu offers an immersive Thai experience.  Theyâ€™ve always been quick to serve, and it seems their menu has evolved a lot over the past 10 years.

I dined here alone today and ordered the Seafood Pad Chaâ€”it was absolutely delicious! The service was excellent, and the atmosphere is clean, quiet, and peaceful. The restaurant has a strong authentic Thai vibe that makes it feel special. This has definitely become one of my favorite spots in New York.

Nice spot for groups and for alone, they have bar seats so if you want to dine for a quick meal it's good for that too. The beef pad see ew was what I got and it was very flavorful and noodles were perfectly soft and chewy!
Very flavorful. The seafood was incredible

A little change of colour and style for table setting and decoration inside. Some special dishes and drinks on the menu today so I tried the chicken seafood rice noodle stir-fry and have a glass chrysanthemum flower drink. Always friendly staff!

Still my most favourite Thai restaurant to pop in for a quick lunch or group dinner. Love the noodle bowls the best!

They had daily specials at this time when we visited and it was beautifully cooked braised pork with spiced thin noodles with sauce. I also love the sugarcane ice cream! The staff is always attentive and friendly here ğŸ˜Š
We tried duck noodle soup, Sukhothai pork noodle soup and boat noodle soup. They were all really yummy. My most favorite was the Sukhothai pork noodle soup.
Enjoyed a solo dinner here. Loved that they have more things than the usual Thai menu. I really enjoyed the seafood soup. Just the right sweet, spicy, and sour.

Ottimo ristorante thailandese, piatti semplici e ben cucinati. Il calamaro grigliato Ã¨ stato ottimo, grande abbastanza per una cena.
Anche il pad thai preso dai miei amici era molto buono.
Le porzioni in generale sono piÃ¹ che sufficienti per una cena, lo staff Ã¨ gentile, il proprietario in particolare molto simpatico. Lo raccomando!

We came, we sat, we ate, and left all within 15 mins. Came here after a show just before 10pm and they were able to sit us and serve food all within 5 minutes. We gobbled our food and was on our way home in no time. They automatically charged gratuity for our party of 5. The drunken noodle was flavor and had the â€œwok hay.â€
Amazing food,  Good service

Unhelpful, slow, and rude service. I have been there a couple of times and have experienced unpleasant service.

The food is ok.

On one visit, their menu was only digital and required watching an ad before seeing the menu. Hopefully, they have removed this annoyance since.

Do not recommend eating there.

Amazing food! If you are gluten allergic/  intolerant, your options are Pad Thai and Green Curry. I had the Pad Thai was moist and rich, not too sweet. Lycee Martini was so smooth. Definitely recommend!
Fabulous! Our group ordered several dishes to try and share! Miat reserve a table! Must go!
I come to this place every time I'm in the city. Over the years, it consistently delivers great value with delicious dishes and friendly service.

Authentisches, vorzÃ¼gliches Thai-Food und eine absolut freundliche Bedienung zeichnen dieses gemÃ¼tliche Restaurant in Manhattan aus. Das mittlere Preisniveau ist absolut angemessen. Wir kommen bei unserem nÃ¤chsten Besuch in New York sehr gerne wieder.
tight space but sooo worth it for the delicious food. staff were so sweet and lovely!
Affordable food served quickly and hot. Flavors good but curry was a little thin (watery) and Pad See Ew too sweet. Beef in curry was extremely dry.

Un endroit incroyable ! La nourriture excellente ! Le personnel exceptionnel! Que dire dâ€™autre ? Ã€ part quâ€™il faut y aller vite et surtout y retourner ! Un must ! Merci Ã  toute lâ€™Ã©quipe ! Quel plaisir en bouche !
Great Thai
Amazing food!! Specially the pad Thai
Itâ€™s really small tables and chairs but food delicious. One of the best

Pure Thai Cookhouse is a cozy spot with authentic Thai flavors.
Everything was delicious but the chili shrimp was crazy good. Worth going out of your way for.

This place is a must-visit! The noodles are incredibly tasty and the other Thai dishes are just as flavorful. Iâ€™ve been here twice already, and both times the food and service were perfect. Special thanks to Khem, who was incredibly kind and attentive, making sure everything was perfect for us. Definitely a 5-star experience!

I love this Thai restaurant in New York!ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¸ The noodles taste just like home, and the larb kua is exactly like the authentic Thai food ğŸ‡¹ğŸ‡­we have back in Thailand. Every staff member is so friendly and welcoming. I highly recommend everyone to come and try it!â¤ï¸â¤ï¸â¤ï¸â¤ï¸â¤ï¸
If youâ€™re craving authentic Thai food in New York, this is THE place to go. Donâ€™t miss it â€” especially the larb kua!

The food here is absolutely delicious! The noodles have an authentic Thai flavor, and every single dish is packed with amazing taste â€” yes, every single one. You can truly experience real Thai cuisine without having to fly to Thailand. The prices are very reasonable, and the staff are attentive and friendly without being overbearing. Highly recommended!

They enforced a 22% tip on our party of five without even asking. Iâ€™ve been to many restaurants before, and while larger parties often have tips included, weâ€™re usually informed beforehand and told the tip amount. When I asked, they simply said itâ€™s their policyâ€”basically stealing from tourists.

Autentico, buono, personale discreto e non invadente. Il locale Ã¨ davvero ben curato e caratteristico
Servizio rapido ed efficiente
Porzioni tipicamente abbondanti come in tutti i ristoranti americani, qualitÃ  ottima.
I prezzi sono leggermente alti ma in linea con il resto delle attivitÃ
Truly authentic Thai flavors, every dish was delicious! The noodles, the appetizer, and the somtum were all spot on. Tastes just like home ğŸ‡¹ğŸ‡­ğŸ’› Highly recommended!
I had green curry with beef today and had diarrhea afterwards!
Nice food good people here
Great Pad Thai and other noodles. Nice restaurant for occasional dinner.

The food and service were good until they let us leave, even though I was still having my beer. The waitress said, â€œThe table is reserved, and the customers are waiting.â€ I think that is not right. They should serve the customer who is there first. I get it, you have customers waiting in line, but I paid for the food and drinks, and I was still having my beer. The experience was not very pleasant due to this incident.
Asking for glass of water but not provided ğŸ˜¡â€¦
Amazing service

We came here as a group of three friends and had such a great experience! We ordered the fried chicken wings, spring rolls, Thai papaya salad, and noodles â€” everything was absolutely delicious. The flavors were authentic and well-balanced. Service was fast and friendly, which made the meal even more enjoyable. Highly recommended for anyone craving tasty Thai food!

Really good Thai spot in HK - There are a ton of Thai Places around and this is currently ranking at the top for me. Got the Fried Chicken Wings and the Wok Chili Pepper Steak. Both were great and Iâ€™d have no issue ordering them again. I requested some serious spice in my entree and they did not disappoint - it was spicy. So if you are into that they will satisfy your needs. Cool atmosphere and food was good. Recommend it if you are looking for Thai in Hellâ€™s kitchen.

Terrible Thai restaurant. The steamed vegetables I (fortunately) ended up taking to go, as you can see from the photo, are brown. We ordered 3 of the same dishes with different spice levels: one not spicy, and two medium . When the waiter brought the dishes, he didnâ€™t mention which was which. When we pointed it out, he claimed we had ordered â€œmildâ€ and not â€œnot spicy.â€ Then, possibly the manager came over, instead of apologizing for the situation (we had only asked which plate was the non-spicy one) , she said that â€œmildâ€ just means slightly spicy and that you can simply remove the chili. Excellent service, as you can tell.
On top of that, the service was slow, the food was terrible, and it took them 20 minutes just to pay. The entire staff was unprofessional.

Food tastes fresh and clean, although I did find myself craving a bit more ingenuity with Thai spices and flavors. Each dish we tried was solid, and the mango sticky rice as well. Would come back to try some of the other dishes in case I'm missing out!

Decent food. This is a place that tries to get you to double tip. When it came time to pay the bill I got no itemized bill and just a machine displaying a number with 20% tip already included, but had additional tip options that began at another 18% and you'd need to tap a few options to avoid it. The waiter made no mention of the tip being already included and there was nothing exceptional to service to merit more gratuity. I'd have appreciated more price transparency.

This unassuming Thai eatery serves authentic and flavourful noodles and snacks. The beef boat noodle is as good as what I have had in Thailand. If you are not used to spicy food, you better check with the waiter before placing your order.

Stumbled upon Pure Thai Cookhouse while looking for lunch in the areaâ€”and Iâ€™m so glad I did! In a neighborhood full of Thai spots, this one truly stands out. The vibe is casual and rustic, with friendly, attentive service.

I ordered the Noodle Kiew Hang from the specials menu along with a Turmeric Lemongrass Tonic. The flavors were bold, balanced, and absolutely deliciousâ€”the entree had a perfect mix of sweet and heat. The tonic was light and refreshing.

Canâ€™t wait to come back and explore more of their menu. Highly recommend giving this spot a try!

Thinking about Thai authentic food I would love to recommend this amazing restaurant. I ordered Pad Thai with Thai spicy was so incredible. I really love Thai spicy. I asked my server to get extra raw bean sprout. She served immediately as you ask for. I will be back and tell my friend to try this restaurant for sure.
This is a good place to eat before or after a broadway show. The food was really good but the seating is pretty tight so just know you will be sitting inches away from other people.

I took my cousins to their first Thai food experience, and this place was perfect. We got some classic dishes and everything was delicious. Great staff and cute place.
(we didnâ€™t have any alcohol and spent around $29 per person)
Very, very solid. Highly recommend the grilled squid app if itâ€™s on rotation. The duck salad was delicious.

Had a wonderful experience here! The staff is super friendly and the food is great.
Weâ€™ve been to Thailand several times and this place feels like the real deal.
Thank you guys!

Authentic Thai food. After living in Thailand for 7 years, I cannot stop looking for real Thai food to enjoy this firework of tastes. Most of them are just an imitation of Thai food. But this one is a real gem. If you are looking for authentic Thai food, this place is a must-visit. I will definitely be coming back!
Love eating this place! Every year we travel we come hereâ¤ï¸ I love ordering the papaya salad and just tried their squid dish. Amazing as always!

So delicious! I came to dine solo and the staff were so friendly. I don't always get a drink, but the lychee martini intrigued me and I'm so glad I got it! It was sweet but not too sweet and served ice cold. So good. Everything on the menuâ€¦

Wok basil is super duper good. Savory, with the aroma of green and red pepper, it goes well with rice. Crab fried rice is also amazing. Also a warning to those who havenâ€™t tried Pad Thai before: they got authentic Pad Thai and it is VERY sweet, so donâ€™t order it unless you like sweetness

At pure Thai, the air was thick with aromatic spices as we entered. The ambiance struck a perfect balance between quaint charm and culinary fervor reminiscent of a hidden gem. We navigated through a labyrinth of tables, our journey punctuated by the hustle of the kitchen. After we took our first bites, I felt their warm embrace of a far away distant land yearning to tighten its grip upon my sensesâ€¦..
